intro: Borreria eryngioides var. affinis, commonly known as the Mexican thornapple, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
